Context:
International students who are not residing in Canada are eligible for a credit or refund for the Student Association Health Insurance paid fees. The International Centre at George Brown College supports international students, staff, and other members of the learning community. International students must have valid documents to stay and study in Canada. Scholarships for international students are typically in-program and based on academic performance and other criteria.

Important dates, application forms, and FAQs related to withdrawals or refunds can be found on George Brown College's website. To graduate officially and work after graduation, students need to complete certain requirements and set up an appointment with an International Student Advisor for more in-depth advising. A proof of enrolment or certification letter is required for various application processes and can be requested once a study permit has been submitted.

George Brown College offers health insurance for international students, fitness centres, fitness classes, intramural sports teams, academic transcripts, and official documentation services. For more detailed information about these services, please visit the relevant websites or contact the college directly.

International students can opt for an enhanced health plan each policy year prior to the deadline date at no additional cost. The George Brown Athletics department offers fitness centres, fitness classes, and intramural sports teams. Students can request official academic transcripts from George Brown College through a formal request process.

Context: For requesting a transcript from George Brown College, more information can be found on their transcript webpage. The college provides free, confidential help for academic and non-academic issues through their professional counsellors. Students can book an appointment by dropping by one of the counselling offices or emailing letstalk@georgebrown.ca. The Career Centre offers various services to help students achieve their career goals such as workshops, an online job board, and individual consultations with an advisor. More information about these services can be found on the Career Centre webpage. If someone wants to visit a student in Canada, they will most likely need to apply for a Temporary Resident Visa (TRV). George Brown College has an Ask George FAQs section for answers to questions about admissions, registration, and student support services. The contact information is 416-415-2000, TTY: 1-877-515-5559, and ask.george@georgebrown.ca. The college's social media hub can also be visited for more information. The information on the website is subject to change without notice and students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
